intro: Hippocratea yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan moonseed, is a climbing plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces distinctive yellow or green pods that contain seeds with a hard, smooth coat. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in humid, lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
